attributes.action: Make it a requirement that all Primary School Teachers are First Aid Trained.
attributes.background:
Implement First Aid Training into Teacher Training Courses at universities and schools. 

Make First Aid Training a prerequisite for any person before they become a Qualified Teacher and are left in charge of a class of up to 30 children alone, between the ages of 4 and 11.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no legislation stating a minimum number of First Aid trained staff in a primary school. 

Currently it is up to the Governors and Head Teacher to carry out a risk assessment, based on the outlay of the school, students, staff and other factors, as to how many members of staff they need to be First Aid trained. 

Class Teachers are left alone with up to 30 children in their care, yet there is no legislation stating that they need to have had any previous First Aid Training.

attributes.action: Save "Princess Anne" the last surviving SRN4 hovercraft for the nation.
attributes.background: "Princess Anne" is the last remaining SRN4 Hovercraft that was used to cross the channel up until 1st October 2000. She is due to be disposed of in the coming months. This great craft is the last remaining of its class and shows Great British Engineering, Innovation and Skill at its best!"
attributes.additional_details: The Hovercraft Museum at Lee-on-solent is ready and waiting in the wings to take Princess Anne on to protect and restore her for the nation. We ask the UK Government to step in and ensure that she is not disposed of as part of a government scheme with Homes and Communities.

attributes.action: Ensure RCOG & NICE Guidelines are followed after waters break early in pregnancy
attributes.background: In 2% of pregnancies,waters break early without labour commencing & can prolong from 12wks to 34wks. Medical term is PPROM & associated with 40% pre-term delivery.We are asking that going forward all medical staff to follow the RCOG & NICE Guidelines for Care of Women presenting with suspected PPROM
attributes.additional_details:
In 2010, I lost my first child Sinead to PPROM. I was sent home without diagnosis & antibiotics which led to me going into premature labour. Sadly my daughter died and I became very ill. If guidelines on care for women presenting with PPROM had been followed the outcome could have been VERY different.
More information on PPROM (Preterm Prelabour (Premature) Rupture of Membranes can be found here: http://www.little-heartbeats.org.uk/
Success stories with management care,  http://www.little-heartbeats.org.uk/#!the-wall-of-our-pprom-miracle-babies/c3w4
In memory of all our babies that did not make it.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if the result of the EU Referendum is to LEAVE the EU.
attributes.background:
If the British people vote against the Conservative Government's recommendation to stay in the EU, then this should be taken as a vote of no confidence by the British People in the current government.

In this case we call on our elected MPs to pass a resolution to hold an early general election.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 2 of the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2012 states:

An early general election is held if:

If the House of Commons resolves "That this house has no confidence in Her Majesty's Government"; or

If the House of Commons, with the support of two-thirds of its total membership (including vacant seats), resolves "That there shall be an early general election"

In either of these two cases, the Monarch appoints the date of the new election by proclamation.

attributes.action: Recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture
attributes.background: We call on the Government to recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture, not just to the UK economy, but to the health and wellbeing of people, and ask for policies to recognise its importance across all relevant Government departments.
attributes.additional_details: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that gardening has health and wellbeing benefits, both in terms of physical activity to being beneficial to suffers of mental health issues. These benefits cut across all age ranges, from young people learning about healthy eating and where our food comes from through "growing their own" to older generations benefiting from regular physical activity which has beneficial implication in terms of mental and physical wellbeing.

attributes.action: Change the law to bar convicted sex offenders from local council service.
attributes.background:
We believe that convicted sex offenders should be barred from holding public office as either a Parish Councillor or Local Authority Councillor.
As the law stands, a convicted sex offender cannot be forced to resign. 
We believe this is wrong & once convicted of a crime, sex offenders must resign.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year a parish Councillor was found guilty in Court of downloading more than 400 indecent images from a website.
Despite public pressure, the councillor has refused to resign.
The local MP for the area has been pushing the Government for a change in the law.
It is important that the law is changed so, in future, convicted sex offenders would not have the opportunity to hold public office once they had been convicted.

attributes.action: Make Washington Tyne & Wear independent from Sunderland City Council
attributes.background: Since Sunderland City Council took over Washington Development Corporation they have used our money to pay for upgrades and improvements to Mowbray Park, Barnes Park, the City Centre and we in Washington are being left out in the cold. Our public services have been cut severely. Take back control
attributes.additional_details: Facebook group Washington in Decline has seen the addition of almost 1,600 member in the last 2 days. Residents from around Washington are uniting in this common cause to stop the rot. Photographs of the litter, the overflowing bins, the fly tipping,  the overgrowing trees and shrubbery and the grass verges along our roads and highways that are causing disruprion and becoming a danger to motorists. We need to stop this NOW. We need an independent voice and independent Council!!

attributes.action: Stop further public funds being used to set out the case for remaining in the EU
attributes.background: The recent distribution of literature at a cost of over £9 Million, making the case for the UK to remain in the EU, undermines the Electoral Commissions objectives of the Referendum and demonstrates a lack of integrity by the Government. We believe voters deserve a fair referendum
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral commission has put a spending limit of £7 million for each of the designated Lead campaign groups (Remain or Leave) in the EU referendum. This has been designed to make the case fair for both sides. By Spending £9.2 million the Government have clearly shown bias using Tax Payers funds. We, the petitioners, request the Government to prevent future tax payer funds, from any source, UK or EU, being used to make the case for the UK remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: DVLA to create a driving test specific to the geared scooter at 210cc limit
attributes.background: Scooterists are having to learn on large powered motorcycles in order to access an additional 85cc only. Not only is the training irrelevant, but subjects the rider to risks outside those which he chose to engage to road on a scooter. Training should be relevant to the end purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Scooter enthusiasts are having to ride motorcycles to pass their test. As a result, many take a CBT biannually, which is increasing in cost exponentially. 2014 £50 with hire 2016 £100-120 with hire

Petition sponsored by Scooter Workshop Community

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to falsely report someone for benefit fraud.
attributes.background: Anyone can report benefit fraud, but it is concerning that this can be done anonymously and surely leads to malicious reports made simply to cause upset to someone. I believe that it should be an offence to knowingly falsely report someone for benefit fraud as it also wastes DWP time and money.

attributes.action: Change NHS sight tests to meet the needs of people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: There are huge levels of sight problems amongst people with learning disabilities but they suffer unequal access to eye care. This is leaving many people with poor vision or even tragically losing their sight.
attributes.additional_details: The charity SeeAbility is calling for national pathways of eye care for people with learning disabilities, including for children in special schools, and for all working age adults with learning disabilities to be eligible for NHS funded sight tests. People are likely to need additional time or appointments to complete a sight test. This requires the Department of Health and NHS England to change the statutory and funding framework for NHS sight tests, to deliver an equal right to sight.

attributes.action: Support individuals with Electrosensitivity and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government, the NHS, and other official organisations/agencies, to recognise and support individuals with Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity (EHS) and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity (MCS), and to implement the recommendations outlined in the following documents as quickly as possible:
attributes.additional_details:
PACE Resolution 1815

http://assembly.coe.int/nw/xml/XRef/Xref-XML2HTML-en.asp?fileid=17994&

International EMF Scientist Appeal

https://www.emfscientist.org/

2015 Brussels International Scientific Declaration on Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity 

http://eceri-institute.org/fichiers/1441982765_Statement_EN_DEFINITIF.pdf

Professor Dominique Belpomme paper

http://www.degruyter.com/view/j/reveh.2015.30.issue-4/reveh-2015-0027/reveh-2015-0027.xml?format=INT

attributes.action: All Steel used in the HS2 project should be made in UK steel plants.
attributes.background:
The reason for this partition is to:
1: To help revive our failing steel plants and both secure jobs and create new jobs, and
2: To ensure the highest quality of steel is used.
The cheapest is very rarely the best.
attributes.additional_details: It appears that George Osborne has 'invited' the Chinese to tender for this massive project - this is bad news for the UK manufacturing industry.

attributes.action: Fast track naturalisation for EU citizens resident in the UK longer than 5 years
attributes.background: In view of the vote to leave the EU, implement a simplified fast track process to naturalise EU citizens who have settled in the UK for at least five years. The current naturalisation process is too expensive, overlong and bureaucratic, and penalises mixed EU-UK families.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost three millions EU citizens residing in the UK. Many have settled and created families with British citizen. The split of the UK from the EU will put that status of these people at risk because of the length, complexity and cost of the existing naturalisation process. A fast track process will also ease the pressure on the naturalisation office given the expected surge in applications from EU nationals.

attributes.action: Charge non-resident parents who evade child support payments with child neglect.
attributes.background:
Current legislation does not recognise non-payment of child support as neglect. After a year of non-compliance separate criminal charges should be brought against such non-resident parents for child neglect.

Resident parents should also be able to prosecute non-compliant NRP for financial abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from 2011 indicate that 95.2% of parents who approached the Child Support Agency in order to access their legal entitlement for child maintenance were female. The failure to collect rates are astonishing. It is therefore a gender inequality issue.
This  social injustice needs to be urgently addressed.The far reaching repercussions have to be legally recognised for both the parent with care and the child/ren when one parent fails to support their child/ren.
It is neglect and abuse.

attributes.action: Replace the Wheelchair Symbol with a modern non-disability specific image.
attributes.background: The International Symbol of Access (ISA), also known as the (International) Wheelchair Symbol, was originally designed in 1968. This pre-dates current UK disability law by half a century and, while internationally recognised, is outdated in respect peoples understandings of/and types of disability.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets, shopping centres, stadiums, recreation centres - all of these are public places where many witness what they deem 'abuse' of Disabled Parking bays and/or Accessible Toilets. People become very indignant if people using either are not wheelchair users. It causes a negative view, which later becomes compounded by repeated accusations of, for example, benefit scroungers. Change the symbol. Produce communications that explain the reason for the change. Educate. Tackle discrimination.

attributes.action: Provide a decent standard of maintenance for Armed Forces family accommodation.
attributes.background:
The current contractor, CarillionAmey, is failing in its obligations to maintain the accommodation provided for our armed forces personnel.
Our servicemen and women's families are being left for months on end with serious faults including broken boilers, damp, mould and pest infestations.
attributes.additional_details:
These families are spending months without central heating, relying on a couple of tiny fan heaters to heat an entire house with young children in them. Others have serious damp issues that result in mould growing on walls so fast it needs removing on a daily basis.
The contractors drag the issues out for months on end despite daily complaints and when they do attend they either don't have the correct parts to fix the fault or it is only for a 15 minute appointment where the repairman is only authorised to carry out a "temporary" repair such as painting over the mould patch.

attributes.action: Stop TV licensing!
attributes.background: Stop UK residents from being forced to pay for TV licensing!
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to tax every household within the UK to fund an organisation such as the BBC.
The people who dont wish to watch the BBC have to pay for it.
If a person already subscibes to cable or satellite then they pay twice for the service. No other service in the Uk is allowed to get away with blanket charges to every household whether or not consumers use their service!

attributes.action: Restrict all dog breeding establishments to a maximum of 5 litters per year
attributes.background: The Panorama programme on BBC1 highlighted the horror of puppy farming. These people own hundreds of dogs and make vast sums of money from breeding puppies, many of whom are sick or have inherited conditions. Restricting all breeding establishments to 5 litters a year will eradicate puppy farms.
attributes.additional_details: There is a wealth of evidence on puppy farming and that local authorities are routinely granting licences to establishments that are churning out puppies that are sick, have inherited conditions and behaviours issues due to the limited human contact and the conditions they are raised in.

attributes.action: Stop the needless destruction of Military Working Dogs.
attributes.background: Everyday Military working dogs, heroes that have saved countless Military and civilian lives are being destroyed. Please sign my petition to help these dogs get the life they deserve! My boy would be dead today if I hadn't have pushed to rehome him. Let's push for the other heroes! Thank You
attributes.additional_details: Please read Vidar's story. Google my name Angie McDonnell. Thank You

attributes.action: Bring Carer's Allowance rules in line with other working-age benefits
attributes.background: Carer's Allowance is payable at £62.10 per week, whereas Job Seekers Allowance is up to £73.10. Moreover, the eligibility threshold requires at least 35 hours of care provided. In contrast Working Tax Credit thresholds are 30 hours, and 16 hours for certain categories.
attributes.additional_details:
Carer's Allowance recipients have a higher hour threshold than workers, for a lower rate of benefit than Job Seekers. The rate of Carer's Allowance undermines the value of the work undertaken (estimated at £119bn per year - Carers UK and the University of Leeds (2011) Valuing Carers 2011: Calculating the value of carers’), and the additional expenses that caring can incur -  (Carers UK (2014) Facts about Carers).
CA should be £73.10 for 30 hours, and a lower rate introduced for 16 hours care.

attributes.action: MPs under investigation should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons
attributes.background: MPs under investigation for election fraud should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons. How is it possible for us to live in a democracy when our own MPs are not held accountable for their actions, and even if they are the police answers to the house so it's therefore a conflict of interest

attributes.action: Compel councils to provide Aires within their towns for the use of Motorhomes.
attributes.background:
In much of the EU. MOTORHOMES are seen as a help to the local economy and are provided with spaces to park in towns, and villages 
In the UK this is not done and local authorities are now bringing in blanket bans on these types of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: Spain, France, Portugal and Germany have these Aires or Stellenplatz,only the UK does not. An Aire is an area in a carpark or community centre for example where Motorhomes can park for a period up to 24 hours. If we are truly part of Europe why do we not have the same areas provided by councils in this country. European governments understand that by allowing Motorhome to park they are encouraging people to visit their country which boosts their economy of nearby shops and restaurants.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding additional funding availability in Referendums.
attributes.background:
The cap for spending in official referendum campaigns is the same for both sides.
If one side has a Lead Campaigner it is possible to have additional funding.
This is unfair & legislation should be changed so that additional funding is only available if both sides have a Lead Campaigner
attributes.additional_details:
At some point in this Parliament the EU  Referendum will be held.
Under the Political Parties Elections and Referendums Act, the cap for funding in the official campaign is the same for both sides.
However, as the law currently stands, it is possible for a side with a Lead Campaigner to have additional funding.
This is allowed even if the opposing side does not have a Lead Campaigner
PPERA should be changed so that additional funding is only available if both sides have a Lead Campaigner.

attributes.action: Ban installation of Sound Limiters in all wedding venues (or increase the limit)
attributes.background: More and more venues are fitting (or are being forced to fit) sound limiters in a bid to appease local council noise restrictions. Whilst this can be good news for local residents living near the venue, it can wreak havoc on a live bands performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Most limiters have a noise restriction of 90-95 Decibels.

At this limit, loud applause can trigger the sound limiter.

When you consider a 5 piece wedding band will normally be in excess of 100 Decibels. A Big Band or Orchestra will be louder still. On top of this, if you consider the loudness of an audience or wedding party, accompanied by alcohol, the sound limiter limit is far too low. 
Please sign this petition to support the removal of Sound Limiters or a increase in sound level allowed

attributes.action: To help establish St George's Day as a national holiday for England.
attributes.background: I wish to start the petition to help gain support for St George's Day becoming a national holiday, a day to celebrate and reconnect with our roots and to celebrate the life of England's patron saint.
attributes.additional_details: As most Britons are aware we are a union of great nations however England doesn't appear to have the opportunity to celebrate it's "Englishness" unlike the Scottish, Welsh or N. Irish for we do not have any major holiday to actually celebrate unlike the other countries that make up the union so I believe England should be granted a day off to celebrate and recollect with our English roots just like Scots do with theirs on St Andrews Day. It is unfair that we cannot celebrate our own identity.

attributes.action: Ban the Halal slaughter of animals.
attributes.background: The practice of Halal slaughter of animals is unjust and unnecessary as more humane methods are available. It causes pain and distress to the animals and must be stopped in the United Kingdom. Is it fair to promote groups such as the RSPCA to prevent animal cruelty when abattoirs nationwide do this?
attributes.additional_details:
To demonstrate the cruelty of Halal slaughter the following link will direct you to a distressing video: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZE2svQFH_q0&oref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DZE2svQFH_q0&has_verified=1

Therefore, I am petitioning the government to ban this outdated and barbaric practice.

attributes.action: Transfer long term DLA claims to PiP automatically
attributes.background: People that have been claiming DLA for extended periods of time should be transferred automatically to PiP at the same or increased rate that they where receiving under the old system. They could then be re assessed on a paper assessment at a later date. This would free up the system lightening the
attributes.additional_details:
load on the DWP and negating the need to involve ATOS which is widely recognized as being not fit for purpose.
Re-diagnosing someone using under qualified inexperienced personal is a waste of tax payers money. The high volume of appeals won is testament to this fact. A clinical diagnosis is far more qualified than a practice nurse being paid by numbers. This gov. is wasting far more money trying to weed out the minority that would abuse the system than it saves by finding them.

attributes.action: Abolish ALL prescription charges for people suffering with cystic fibrosis
attributes.background: CF is one of the MOST COMMON, LIFE THREATENING genetic diseases in the UK that becomes PROGRESSIVELY WORSE. Daily, our lives include taking over 50 pills, nebulisers, inhalers, draining physiotherapy regimes 3x a day to clear our lungs of thick sticky mucus & frequent hospitalised stays for IV's.
attributes.additional_details: All of this constant medication is unaffordable, particularly if we become so ill that we can't work. Our quality of life is greatly affected, the thick build up of mucus slowly clogs up all our internal organs and many complications such as cf related liver disease, cf related diabetes and osteoporosis frequently arise. The government funds NO research into CF at all and yet we are only asking for free prescriptions for a condition that fits ALL of the criteria for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Make carbon monoxide testers mandatory in GP surgeries
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to make near patient breath testing devices mandatory in GP practices on the following grounds.
Around 50 people die annually in the UK from carbon monoxide poisoning
CO incidents also send thousands more to hospital every year
Testing kits will save lives
attributes.additional_details:
Carbon monoxide can strike anywhere, but those most at risk are the vulnerable in our society - the young, the elderly, those with pre-existing medical conditions.

However, what is unclear is how many victims are turning first to their family doctor for help from the 'silent killer'.

As front line protectors of the nation's health, GPs must be armed with the tools to swiftly diagnose, and therefore prevent, carbon monoxide poisoning.

Only a small percentage of GP surgeries - about one in five - have the necessary equipment to test for carbon monoxide levels in patients.

These devices cost less than £200 each and will save lives.

attributes.action: make a pass card for parent and child parking like disabled to stop misuse
attributes.background: It's not about being close to the shops it's about having the extra room to open the doors fully to get children in and out of the car easier and not damaging other people's cars. It's also a safety factor for children as well. I want cars to display a pass similar to a disabled pass as proof
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are abusing these spaces that don't have children because they are too lazy to park a car further down the car park. As a parent it is very difficult to get a push chair and child out of a normal sized car space. 
To park in a parent and child space you should display a pass like disabled do if you don't have one you should recieve a fine like people do in a disabled space that don't display a pass

Better control is needed for the safety of children and other peoples property

attributes.action: All Schools to be req. by law to make reasonable ADJ. to attendance policies.
attributes.background: Imagine what it is like to always be the child that will never get an attendance certificate / reward, due to having ongoing healthcare needs & disabilities that impact on a full attendance record.
attributes.additional_details: By schools offering rewards and incentives to children that achieve 100% attendance records they are  penalising children with health needs and disabilities through no fault of their own. They may also have an underlying condition that make them more susceptible to illness requiring absence that they cannot control. We are asking that schools be required by law to make these reasonable adjustments so that children can still participate fully in attendance certificate awards, like their peers.

attributes.action: Abolish Gender Recognition Panel & allow Transpeople to determine gender
attributes.background: Currently the only way for UK person to change their gender is for them to apply to the Gender Recognition Panel. It costs them £140 for the privilege of having to do this. The panel can then turn around and refuse the legal recognition. Even if they have had surgery and lived in the role years.
attributes.additional_details:
The application process can be found under this link:
https://www.gov.uk/apply-gender-recognition-certificate/how-to-apply
As can be seen the panel may require further "proof" that you are living in the role. Despite sending a plethora of information and evidence this panel can decide to refuse your application.
 Under conclusions & recommendations of the Transgender Equality report para 7 recommends trans people are allowed to determine their own gender. This needs to happen in this parliament

attributes.action: Student nurses & midwives should get paid for hrs worked if bursary is scrapped
attributes.background: if the NHS bursary is scrapped, student nurses and midwives should get paid for any hours worked while training. Because currently the bursary is available and nurses and midwives work for free.

attributes.action: Ban animal dissection In all UK primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: As a student who is obliged to take part in these "experiments", I am able to stand up and protest against cruelty. I am aware that many children are upset and disturbed by dissection, but would not have the confidence to refuse to participate and confront their teachers on the matter.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a society that thrives off advanced technology, therefore we should be taking advantage of all the opportunities available from this privilege. We are no longer restricted to text books and the cruel, unnecessary practices such as dissection; other methods such as sophisticated computer software are available and have been shown to teach anatomy and complex biological processes. This is the perfect chance to leave a controversial and cruel practice in the past.

attributes.action: Allow those born in June, July and August 1998 to vote in the EU referendum
attributes.background: Those of us born in the later academic months of 1998 (June, July and August) are just as educated and mature as those born in September to May. We will be leaving school and entering university/further education at the same time as them so why are we deemed 'too young' to vote in the EU referendum?

attributes.action: Everyone on National Minimum Wage should receive the same wage regardless of age
attributes.background: I'm starting this petition simply because I and many others believe it is unfair that the Minimum Wage Rate rises in age groups. Why do under 18's get paid £3.90 less for working the same hours and carrying out the same job role as a 25+ year old?
attributes.additional_details: For example, I myself have been on minimum wage (under 18 wage rate) for just under a year. So if I decided to stay in this job role towards the future, I would have to wait 9 YEARS to receive FULL MINIMUM wage. What will I have done in 9 years of waiting for this wage? Yes, I may have more work experience. Yes, I may be more advanced and have more knowledge in this career. But I will still be working 42 hours a week doing the exact same job daily what I was doing at the age of 18, 9 years ago.

attributes.action: Take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against SriLanka
attributes.background: We the undersigned urge the British government to take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against former and serving officials of the Sri Lankan state for the crimes of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity committed against the Tamils.
attributes.additional_details:
In the last stages of the armed conflict in Sri Lanka, 146, 679 Tamils became unaccounted for - either massacred or ‘disappeared’ by the Sri Lankan armed forces.

The UN announced in September 2015 that if established before a court of law, Sri Lanka’s actions may amount to war crimes and/or crimes against humanity. Subsequently, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights noted that if independent trials were to take place, a court of law may even find Sri Lanka guilty of committing genocide.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Syrian asylum seekers
attributes.background: Faisal, 18 years old, and his father Ahmad are Syrians who arrived in the UK to seek asylum in June 2015. They are both facing deportation to Hungary where they were forced to claim asylum under duress. A considerable proportion of those returned to Hungary were detained in asylum detention centres.
attributes.additional_details: The Council of Europe Commissioner for Human Rights, Nils Muižnieks, has stated that 'asylum seekers returned to Hungary run a considerable risk of being subject to human rights violations.' Also, as there are systemic flaws in the asylum procedure and in the reception conditions in Hungary, the UK is not permitted under international law to deport asylum seekers to that country. The only other option for Ahmad and his son is to return to Syria and face the risk of being killed in the conflict.

attributes.action: Re-open the railway link from Wisbech to the national rail network.
attributes.background:
Following the ill conceived Beeching recommendations proposed during the 1960's, the Wisbech track and station were deemed unnecessary and removed from service.

The government at the time believed that the link was no longer needed as the population would simply resort to road transport.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Beeching proposals there have been:

1. A marked increase in the population locally
2. Significant influx of migrant labour from EU members
3. Significant migration of population from London and the South east
4. Significant commercial increases in investment in Cambridge and the surrounding areas
5. Significant increase in traffic densities 
6. Reduction in public road transport services in the North Cambridgeshire area
7. Increased demand for rail services into Cambridge and the wider rail networks

The re-introduction of the link would enable the local population to access to enhanced employment opportunities in the region and London, it would also enhance the regeneration ambitions of the area and provide further momentum for commercial investment in the region.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the Mental Health Welland Centre in Market Harborough.
attributes.background: This centre is my sole source of free support where I, like so many others, have crucial appointments with a psychiatrist. The closure of this centre means appointments would be held in Wigton. But for people who cannot drive and have anxiety when using public transport this will made be difficult.
attributes.additional_details: The wider issue here is the governments neglect of the mental health services in the United Kingdom. I realise there are probably many cases in towns, villages or cities where these centres are being closed down and I would encourage those effected by these changed to petition against them too.

attributes.action: Do not amend the Hunting Act using a Statutory Instrument
attributes.background:
Mr Cameron is likely to repeal the fox hunting ban through the back door using a Statutory Instrument which does not require a vote in parliament. Over 80% of the British people and most MPs don't wish to see fox hunting reintroduced.

Please sign to show your disgust in this undemocratic act.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron has said he believes in the "freedom to hunt" and wants fox hunting legalised. He will go to any lengths to achieve this including riding over the will of parliament and that of the British people.

Fox hunting involves chasing and killing a fox, on horseback, with a pack of dogs, in traditional dress. This is a vicious and outdated pastime, and the idea of repealing the ban introduced by the Labour government, so that people like Cameron can hunt and kill foxes is a horrific one.

attributes.action: Amend Official Secrets Act to prohibit its use in cases involving child abuse
attributes.background: Over several decades the Official Secrets Act has been misused to protect paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest and we call on the government to amend the act to ensure that this can not happen again.

attributes.action: Introduce road user education into the national curriculum.
attributes.background: In 2014 1700 died on the roads of the UK.  In the same period 300 drowned.  Such loss is horrific and devastating to all those involved.  We address water danger by teaching swimming in schools yet there is nothing formalised in relation to road user education.  Help us change this and save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics taken from the World Health Organisation website.
Allowing 16 and 17 year olds onto the roads with a fraction of the knowledge they require to be safe is contributing to the loss of life and terrible injuries sustained.  Introduction within the curriculum of driving experience based simulation and attitudinal work would, without doubt, save lives. A vast majority of those students will drive or ride on the roads.

attributes.action: Change the Gambling Act to prevent bookmakers conning people.
attributes.background: Most Bookmakers with a UK licence routinely and on mass, ban some customers from taking part in their publicly advertised promotions. This is false advertising and conning people to gamble, then refusing without reason to honour the advertised offer and excluding them from all future offers.
attributes.additional_details: Ban Bookmakers using the term "We reserve the right to restrict or exclude people from our offers at our discretion and without notice or warning" This quite simply should not be allowed it is totally unfair and discriminating. A supermarket cannot exclude customers from its publicly advertised promotion offers, so why is a bookmaker allowed to? In other Countries, where a bookmaker makes an offer public of say "bet £25 and get £25 free" they have to honour that to everyone who takes part in it.

attributes.action: Ban shorting of London AIM stocks,  including shorting by Market Makers
attributes.background:
We believe that shorting stocks on the AIM is damaging to companies, private investors and to the economy. 

Manipulating a share price with borrowed stock is detrimental. Stocks should rise and fall naturally based on fundamentals and any external interference, legal or not should be addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
The purpose of AIM is to support companies looking to grow steadily through investment, In turn creating jobs.

Large orchestrated shorting attacks aren't giving companies a fair chance in an already difficult market. 

Social media and forums are often used during shorting, attempting to panic investors into selling, hence sending the price of the stock down further. 

Only shorters and Market Makers benefit from this

A simple explanation of shorting
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-14510946

attributes.action: Include young workers aged 18-24 in the Government's National Living Wage
attributes.background:
The National Living Wage only applies to workers aged 25+, meaning those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less.

It also goes against the UK electorate. A Survation poll in September 2015 shows 66% of voters believe the NLW should apply to under-25s.
attributes.additional_details:
The statistics that those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work as over 25s and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less are worked out by calculating the percentage difference between the NLW and current NMW pay levels. Current NMW levels: 18-21(£5.30ph) and 21-24 (£6.70ph)

Link to the poll by Survation: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/09/26/poll-under-25s-should-be-given-national-living-wage_n_8194992.html

attributes.action: keep F1 (Formula 1) on free to air television
attributes.background: From 2019, Formula 1 will no longer be shown on free to air television in the UK. All rights have been purchased by Sky which means the only way to view will be by paying a monthly subscription. The British GP is the only race that will be shown for free. Please sign if you think this is unfair.

attributes.action: Grant Patrick Aganozor a VISA to donate his bone marrow to his brother
attributes.background: Patrick Aganozor is a 50% match for his brother's cell transplant who is in urgent need of bone marrow donation in order to  save him from leukaemia. Patrick - who lives in Nigeria- was a refused a visa into the Uk in April by the British High Commission. Time is running out to save Isaac...
attributes.additional_details: In August 2015 Isaac Aganozor was diagnosed with leukaemia. Isaac (44) continued to work until December 2015 when his condition deteriorated and he was no longer able to work. Isaac's hopes of fighting the disease were boosted when his brother tested as a  50% match for his brother's treatment. The British High Commissioner in Lagos, however, refused his VISA on the grounds that he was not convinced that Patrick will 'leave the Uk at the end of your stay'.If we are to save Isaac we must act now.

attributes.action: Protect whistleblowing junior doctors
attributes.background: Junior doctors who raise concerns about patient safety do not have full protection under the law, and could lose their career.  We ask that junior doctors have full whistleblowing legal protection, in the same manner as student nurses
attributes.additional_details:
In England, a junior doctor's career is controlled by a public body called Health Education England (HEE).  HEE controls long term employment, and can make decisions to remove a doctor from training.  At this moment in time, if a doctor fears they are being punished for whistleblowing, the decisions of HEE cannot be held to account in an employment tribunal.

http://www.54000doctors.org/thecase/1-intro-and-how-this-case-affects-you.html
